intro: Acetosella conorrhiza, commonly known as the hairy sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs. Acetosella conorrhiza thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild astringent properties.
